name: Sphagnum Moss
description: Sphagnum palustre, commonly known as Sphagnum Moss, Peat Moss, or Bog Moss, is a semi-aquatic to terrestrial moss native to bogs, fens, and wetlands in temperate and boreal regions worldwide, including North America, Europe, and Asia. It belongs to the Sphagnaceae family and features upright, branching stems covered in small, overlapping leaves. The leaves are bright green to yellow-green and have specialized cells (hyaline cells) that can hold up to 20 times their weight in water. The plant displays a clumping, cushion-forming growth habit and typically reaches 5-15 cm in height. It can grow floating in water or attached to wet substrates. In its native habitat, it grows in acidic bogs and wetlands, often forming dense mats. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant provides excellent water retention and can be used as a substrate component. It's popular for carnivorous plant cultivation due to its acidic nature and water-holding capacity.
careTips: Excellent water retention - can hold up to 20 times its weight in water
Can be used as substrate component or grown as a plant - very versatile
Requires very high humidity (70-90%) - ideal for closed terrariums or paludariums
Acidic nature (pH 4.0-5.5) makes it good for carnivorous plants and acid-loving species
Native to bogs and wetlands - prefers cool to moderate temperatures (10-24Â°C)
Bright indirect light is best - can tolerate some direct light
Keep consistently moist or can grow floating in shallow water
Can be used in terrariums, paludariums, and ripariums
Non-toxic and safe for terrarium inhabitants
Propagates via spores or division - simply separate portions and place elsewhere
If moss turns brown, increase humidity and check watering schedule
Excellent for creating bog-like environments in paludariums
